contentList.content:
In combat, a bladesinger uses a series of intricate, elegant maneuvers that fend off harm and allow the bladesinger to channel magic into devastating attacks and a cunning defense.
Level 2 - <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="TrainingInWarAndSong">Training in War and Song</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Bladesong_Resource">Bladesong</LSTag> Level 6 - <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ExtraAttack_Bladesinging">Extra Attack</LSTag> Level 10 - <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="SongOfDefense">Song of Defense</LSTag> Level 14 - <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="SongOfVictory">Song of Victory</LSTag>
Bladesinging
Choose a type of one-handed melee weapon to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in.
Training in War and Song

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with light armor and you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with one type of one-handed melee weapon of your choice. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the Performance skill if you donâ€™t already have it.

You can direct your magic to absorb damage while your Bladesong is active. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend one <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> and reduce that damage to you by an amount equal to five times the <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot's</LSTag> level.
You can add your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> modifier (minimum of +1) to the damage of your melee weapon attacks while your Bladesong is active.
When you would take damage, you can expend a Level [1] <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> and reduce the damage dealt to you by [2].
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Effect ends when you have less than half of your total Movement.

Gain the ability to move up your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> without provoking <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> and restore [1] to allied creatures within [2] once.

Forge an empowering bond among yourself or your allies. While bonded, creatures within [1] of each other can add a [2] bonus an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> it makes once per turn.
Add bonus of +[1] to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.

You can forge an empowering bond among people who are at peace with one another. As an action, you choose [1] allied creatures within [2] of you (including yourself) and create a magical bond among them or until you use this feature again. While any bonded creature is within [2] of another, the creature can add a bonus of +[3] to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> it makes once per turn.
Activate to add a bonus of +[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Weapon already affected by the Hex Warrior feature.
Cannot be used on a two handed weapon.
Bladesong Charge
Bladesong
Invoke an elven magic called the Bladesong, gracing you with supernatural speed, agility and focus as long as you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield.
Your Bladesong ends early if you are incapacitated, if you don medium or heavy armor or a shield, or if you use two hands to make an attack with a weapon.

<LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armor Class</LSTag> and Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> to maintain concentration increased by [1], your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is increased by [2] and have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Acrobatics <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
Dismiss Bladesong
Dismiss the effects of Bladesong.
Bladesinging: Extra Attack
Can make an additional free attack or cast a cantrip after making an unarmed or weapon attack.
Song of Defense
When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot and reduce the damage taken by five times the spell slot's level.
When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend a Level [1] spell slot and reduce the damage taken by [2].
Reduced damage taken by -[1].
Song of Victory
The damage of your melee weapon attacks is increased by your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> modifier while your Bladesong is active.
The number of times you can use the Bladesong feature.
Cannot activate while wearing medium or heavy armor or while equipped with a shield.
No Proficiency
You can choose to not become proficient in a weapon.
Instinctive Pounce
As part of the bonus action you take to enter your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag>, you can move up to half your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag>.
<LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> increased by half.
Magical Inspiration

If a creature has a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag> from you and casts a spell that restores hit points or deals damage, the creature can roll that die. Add the number rolled as a bonus to the hit points regained or the damage dealt. The <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag> is then lost.
Magical Inspiration: Damage
Add an additional [1] damage when you deal damage to a creature with a spell.
Magical Inspiration: Healing
Heal an additional [1] hit points when you heal a creature with a spell.
Can add an additional [1] to damage dealt or hit points restored by a spell by expending anm <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag>.
Harness Divine Power

You can your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ChannelDivinity">Channel Divinity</LSTag> to fuel your spells. As a bonus action, you touch your holy symbol, utter a prayer, and regain one expended <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>, the level of which can be no higher than half your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> (rounded up). The number of times you can use this feature is based on the level you've reached in this class: 2nd level, once; 6th level, twice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Touch your holy symbol and utter a prayer to regain one expended <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>, the level of which can be no higher than half your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> (rounded up).
Touch your holy symbol and utter a prayer to regain one expended Level 1 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Touch your holy symbol and utter a prayer to regain one expended Level 2 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Touch your holy symbol and utter a prayer to regain one expended Level 3 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
The number of times you can harness divine power to restore an expended <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Divine Power Charge
Blessed Strikes
You are blessed with divine might in battle. Once per turn, when a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal [1] to that creature.
Blessed Strikes Critical
Channel your divine might through a weapon attack, dealing an additional [1].
When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal [1] to that creature.
Divine Strike
Wild Companion

You gain the ability to summon a spirit that assumes an animal form. As an action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FindFamiliar">Find Familiar</LSTag> spell.
You can change your Fighting Style selection.
Martial Versatility
Ki-Fueled Attack

If you spend 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Point</LSTag> or more as part of your action on your turn, you can make one attack with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon as a bonus action before the end of the turn.
Bonus action attack after spending Ki Points as a part of action.
Quickened Healing
You can spend 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> and roll a Martial Arts die to regain [1].
Regain [1].
Focused Aim

When you attack a creature, you can spend 1 to 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to increase your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> by +2 for each point you spend.
Focused Aim: 1 Ki Point
Focused Aim: 2 Ki Points
Focused Aim: 3 Ki Points
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> by +[1].
Favored Foe
The number of times you can use the Favored Foe feature.
You can increase the damage you deal by [1] once per turn whilst marking a creature.
Deal an additional [1] to a favored foe.
Call on your mystical bond with nature to mark a creature as your favored enemy.
Deft Explorer: Canny

Choose one of your skill proficiencies. Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is doubled for any <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> you make using the chosen skill.
Deft Explorer: Roving
Your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> increases by [1].
Deft Explorer: Tireless
Gain [1].
Canny
Canny: Acrobatics
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Animal Handling
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="AnimalHandling">Animal Handling</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Arcana
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Arcana">Arcana</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Athletics
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Deception
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Deception">Deception</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: History
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="History">History</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Insight
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Insight">Insight</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Intimidation
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Intimidation">Intimidation</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Investigation
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Investigation">Investigation</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Medicine
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Medicine">Medicine</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Nature
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Nature">Nature</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Perception
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Performance
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Performance">Performance</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Persuasion
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Persuasion">Persuasion</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Religion
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Religion">Religion</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Sleight of Hand
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="SleightOfHand">Sleight of Hand</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Stealth
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Stealth">Stealth</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Canny: Survival
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Survival">Survival</LSTag> checks is doubled.
Tireless
Gain [1].
Primal Awareness

You can focus your awareness through the interconnections of nature. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class if you don't already know them. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot's</LSTag>. Once you cast a spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Can cast without expending a spell slot.
Speak with Animals: Primal Awareness
Commune with Nature: Primal Awareness
Hide in Plain Sight

As an action, you can camouflage yourself with your environment to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> and gain a +[1] bonus to Stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>, as long as you stand still.
Nature's Veil

You draw on the powers of nature to hide yourself from view briefly by magically become invisible. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> and regain all uses once you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag>.
The number of times you can use Nature's Veil.
The number of times you can use the Tireless feature.
Tireless
Steady Aim

As a bonus action, you can give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> on the current turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is 0 until the end of the current turn.
Give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> but your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is reduced to 0.
Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> but <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is 0.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Cannot be used if you've moved during your current turn.
Can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SteadyAim">Steady Aim</LSTag>.
Magical Guidance

You can tap into your inner wellspring of magic to try and conjure success from failure. You can spend 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> to reroll an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> with a roll of 3 or less and you must use the new roll.

Tap into your inner wellspring of magic to try and conjure success from failure. The next time you make an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, on a roll of 3 or less, you are able to reroll and must use the new roll.
Reroll your next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> with a roll of 3 or less.
Brutal Critical (2)
You've trained to strike swift and true. When you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you roll two extra damage die as well as the normal additional critical dice.
Brutal Critical (3)
You've trained to strike swift and true. When you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you roll three extra damage die as well as the normal additional critical dice.
Retaliation

When you take damage from a creature that is within [1] of you, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.
When you take damage from a creature that is within [1] of you, you can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

When you make an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, you can expend one use of your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag>. Roll a Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
Peerless Skill
Inspire yourself to add a +[1] bonus to your next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
Can use Bardic Inspiration to add a +[1] bonus to the next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
You cannot use this ability while already under its effects.
You can cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DisguiseSelf">Hide</LSTag> spell without using a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Thousand Forms

Your mastery of ki grants you <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in all <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Additionally, if you fail a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can spend a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Point</LSTag> to reroll it and take the second result.
Diamond Soul
You can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> to end one spell on yourself or on one willing creature that you touch.
Cleansing Touch
End a spell on yourself or an ally through your touch.
The number of times you can end spell effects.
Cleansing Touch Charge
You can change your Pact Boon selection.
Eldritch Versatility: Pact Boon
Versatile Trickster
You gain the ability to distract targets with your Mage Hand.

Distract a creature within [1] of your Mage Hand, giving you <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against the creature until the end of your turn.
The Mage Hand's summoner has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on its <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against this entity.
Distract a creature, giving your summoner <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against the creature.
Vanish
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Hide">Hide</LSTag> action as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>.
Share Spells
When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion with the spell if the beast is within [1] of you.
Can be affected by the same spell the ranger casts on their self.
Blindsense

If you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> creature within [1] of you, preventing them from making <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against you with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and preventing them from imposing <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on your attacks against them.

Detected by an entity with Blindsense. <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> cannot benefit from <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> against the entity and cannot impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on attacks from the entity.
Deafened
Dragon Wings
A pair dragon wings sprout from your back, granting you the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly">Fly</LSTag>.
You gain the ability to sprout dragon wings sprout from your back, granting you the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly">Fly</LSTag>.
Dragon Wings: Dismiss
Retract your draconic wings back into your body.
Hurl Through Hell
You gain the ability to transport a creature you've hit with an attack through the lower planes.
When you hit a creature with an attack, you can instantly transport the target through the lower planes, causing the creature to disappear and hurtle through a nightmare landscape.
The target returns to the space it previously occupied at the end of your next turn and takes [1] if it is not a fiend.
This entity has been transported through the lower planes.
This entity has been transported through the lower planes and takes [1] upon returning.
Overchannel

You can increase the power of your simpler spells. When you cast a spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take [1] for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. You take an additional [2] per spell level with each subsequent cast.

When you cast a 1st through 5th level spell that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take [1] for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. You take an additional [2] per spell level with each subsequent cast.
Deal maximum damage with spell of 1st to 5th level.
Overchannel (1)
Overchannel (2)
Overchannel (3)
Overchannel (4)
Overchannel (5)
Overchannel (6)
Overchannel (7)
Overchannel (8)
Take [1] for each level of a damaging spell cast from 1st to 5th level.
Persistent Rage
Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> is so fierce that it ends early only if you fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UNCONSCIOUS">Unconscious</LSTag> or if you choose to end it.
Arcane Charge
You gain the ability to teleport up to [1] after using Action Surge.
Timeless Body
You no longer suffer the negative effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Haste>Haste</LSTag> spell ending.
Soul of Vengeance

The authority with which you speak your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_VowOfEnmity>Vow of Enmity</LSTag> gives you greater power over your foe. When a creature under the effect of your Vow of Enmity makes an attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature if it is within range.
Make a melee weapon attack against a creature that makes an attack while under the effects of your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_VowOfEnmity>Vow of Enmity</LSTag>.
Breath of Winter
Eternal Mountain Defense
River of Hungry Flame
Wave of Rolling Earth
Spell Thief
Failed Spell Thief
You gain the ability to magically steal the knowledge of how to cast a spell from another spellcaster.
Interrupt a creature casting a spell, causing it to fail.
You steal the knowledge of the spell if it is at least 1st level and of a level you can cast.
Spell Thief: Intelligence
Force a creature casting a spell to make an Intelligence <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, possibly causing the spell to fail and learning it if it is of a level you can cast.
Spell Thief: Wisdom
Force a creature casting a spell to make a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, possibly causing the spell to fail and learning it if it is of a level you can cast.
Spell Thief: Charisma
Force a creature casting a spell to make a Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, possibly causing the spell to fail and learning it if it is of a level you can cast.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ArmsOfHadar">Arms of Hadar</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bane">Bane</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BurningHands">Burning Hands</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CharmPerson">Charm Person</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ChromaticOrb">Chromatic Orb</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_ColorSpray">Color Spray</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Command_Container">Command</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DissonantWhispers">Dissonant Whispers</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CompelledDuel">Compelled Duel</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FaerieFire">Faerie Fire</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FogCloud">Fog Cloud</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Grease">Grease</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_GuidingBolt">Guiding Bolt</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Hex">Hex</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HideousLaughter">Hideous Laughter</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HuntersMark">Hunter's Mark</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_IceSpike">Ice Spike</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_InflictWounds">Inflict Wounds</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_MagicMissile">Guiding Bolt</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_RayOfSickness">Guiding Bolt</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Sleep">Guiding Bolt</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_Thunderwave">Guiding Bolt</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_WitchBolt">Guiding Bolt</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_AcidArrow">Acid Arrow</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_AganazzarsScorcher">Aganazzar's Scorcher</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Blindness">Blindness</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CloudOfDaggers">Cloud of Daggers</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CrownOfMadness">Crown of Madness</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Darkness">Darkness</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_EnlargeReduce">Enlarge/Reduce</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Enthrall">Enthrall</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_GustOfWind">Gust of Wind</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HeatMetal">Heat Metal</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HoldPerson">Hold Person</LSTag> spell.
Learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_PhantasmalForce">Phantasmal Force</LSTag> spell.

Indomitale Might
When you make a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, you can roll twice and use the higher result.
Primal Champion
Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.
Superior Inspiration
When you roll initiative and have no uses of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BARDIC_INSPIRATION">Bardic Inspiration</LSTag> left, you regain one use.
Improved Duplicity
You can create up to four duplicates of yourself, instead of one, when you use Invoke Duplicity. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command any number of them to move up to [1].
Command Duplicate(s)
Command your duplicate(s) to move.
Commanded
Can move due to summoner's command.
Divine Intervention Improvement
You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DivineIntervention">Divine Intervention</LSTag> to invoke your God's aid.
Call upon your deity in your moment of greatest need.
Beast Spells

You can cast many of your druid spells in any shape you assume using Wild Shape. You can perform the somatic and verbal components of a druid spell while in a beast shape, but you aren't able to provide material components.
Archdruid

You can use your Wild Shape an unlimited number of times. Additionally, you can ignore the verbal and somatic components of your druid spells. You gain this benefit in both your normal shape and your beast shape from Wild Shape.
Superior Extra Attack
You can make three additional attacks after attacking with your main-hand weapon.
You can take an additional three weapon attacks when you take the Attack action.
Improved War Magic
You have honed your body and magic for war. After you cast a spell, you can make a weapon attack using a bonus action.
Empty Body

You can use your action to spend 4 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> for 10 turns. During that time, you also have <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage but force damage.
You become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> and gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage but force damage.
This entity is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistant</LSTag> to all damage except force damage.
Perfect Self
When you roll for initiative and have no <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> remaining, you regain 4 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag>.
Avenging Angel
You can assume the form of an angelic avenger.

Assume the form of an angelic avenger, granting you the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly">Fly</LSTag>. You also emanate a [1] radius aura of menace which <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightens</LSTag> creatures that enter or start their turn in the aura.
<LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against these <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> creatures also have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.

This entity has the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly">Fly</LSTag> and has a [1] aura that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightens</LSTag> creatures that enters or starts it turn in the aura.

Cannot move. Frightened entities also have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against this entity also have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Angel Wings
These wings were gained from the Avenging Angel feature.
Feral Senses

You gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can't see. When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against it. You are also aware of the location of any <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> creature within [1] of you, provided that the creature isn't hidden from you and you aren't <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag> or Deafened.
Foe Slayer
You become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. Once on each of your turns, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack</LSTag> or damage roll of an attack you make.
Foe Slayer: Attack
Add your Wisdom modifier to the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack</LSTag> roll of an attack you make.
Foe Slayer: Damage
Add your Wisdom modifier to the damage roll of an attack you make.
Draconic Presence
you can channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor, causing those around you to become awestruck or frightened.
Eldritch Master
You can draw on your inner reserve of mystical power while entreating your patron to regain your expended <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> from your Pact Magic feature.
Draw on your inner reserve of mystical power while entreating your patron to regain your expended <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag>.
Regained all expended <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag>.
Spell Mastery
You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will.
Activate to allow you to switch out your 1st and 2nd level Spell Mastery choices after you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Spell Mastery: 1st Level
Choose a 1st-level spell in your spellbook. You can cast the spell at its lowest level without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.

Choose a 2nd-level spell in your spellbook. You can cast the spell at its lowest level without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.

Sorcerous Restoration

Draconic Presence

Channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor, causing those around you to become awestruck or frightened. Hostile creatures that start their turn in the aura are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by you or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> of you.
Draconic Presence: Charm

Channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor, causing those around you to become awestruck. Hostile creatures that start their turn in the aura are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> by you.
Draconic Presence: Frighten

Channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor, causing those around you to become frightened. Hostile creatures that start their turn in the aura are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> by you.
Target is immune to Draconic Presence.
Draconic Presence: Charm
Possibly become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by the source of Draconic Presence.
Draconic Presence: Frighten
Possibly become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> of the source of Draconic Presence.
Draconic Presence: Immunity
This entity is immune to Draconic Presence.
Dedicated Weapon
You train yourself to use a variety of weapons as monk weapons as long as you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with it and it lacks the heavy and special properties.
Touch one weapon that you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with and lacks to heavy property, focusing your ki on it to treat it as a monk weapon.
Treated as a monk weapon.
Elusive

You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> against you while you aren't <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INCAPACITATED">Incapacitated</LSTag>.
Stroke of Luck

You have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need to. When you make an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, you can guaranteed succeed on the roll once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Activate to automatically succeed on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
This entity will guaranteed succeed on the next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
Once used, this ability cannot be used again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
The number of times you can use the <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="StrokeOfLuck">Stroke of Luck</LSTag> feature.
When you make an attack, you can make it automatically succeed regardless of the result.
Absorb Elements: Spell Mastery
Shield: Spell Mastery
Counterspell: Spell Mastery
You can change your Fighting Style selection.
Martial Versatility

You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra [1] to the target. When you reach 14th level in the Cleric class, it deals an extra [2].

You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra [1], [2] or [3] to the target. When you reach 14th level in the Cleric class, it deals an extra [4], [5] or [6].
Deal an additional [1] with a weapon attack or [2] when you've reached 14th level in the Cleric class.
Indomitable (2)

You have become as durable as an iron golem. Whenever you fail a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can roll again, using the new result instead. You can do so twice until you next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Indomitable (3)

You have become as durable as an iron golem. Whenever you fail a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can roll again, using the new result instead. You can do so thrice until you next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
